resource_data:
"<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">

    <catalog>hdl</catalog>

  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>73010</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>SDT</catalog>
            <entry>2a8f1d00-98d4-4c14-b5e2-1f0b7768c767#1#4</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="hu">Kálvária</string>
            <string language="en">Calvary</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Kalvarienberg</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Calvaire</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Calvary</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Calvary</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Calvary</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Calvary</string>
          </title>
          <language>hu</language>
          <description>
            <string language="hu">Kálvária (A kálvária latin szó, koponyát jelent. Ugyanis Jézust a Koponyák hegyén feszítették keresztre. Golgota arameus nyelven szintén koponyát jelent). A keresztút stációinak képei a katolikus templomokban is megtalálhatók.</string>
            <string language="en">Calvary (Calvary is latin word, it means skull. Namely Jesus was crucified on the mountain of Skulls. Golgotha in Aramean language means also skull.) Pictures about the Stations of the Cross are also discoverable in Catholic churches.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="hu">Kálvária,  </string>
            <string language="en">Calvary</string>
          </keyword>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Kalvarienberg (Kalvarienberg ist lateinisches 
Wort, es bedeutet Schädel. Nämlich Jesus crucified auf dem 
Berg der Schädel. Golgotha in der Aramean Sprache bedeutet auch
Schädel.) Abbildungen über die Stationen des Kreuzes sind auch
in den katholischen Kirchen discoverable.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Calvaire (le calvaire est le mot latin, il 
signifie le crâne. À savoir Jésus a été crucifié sur la 
montagne des crânes. Golgotha en langue araméenne signifie 
également le crâne.) Les images au sujet des stations de la 
croix sont également discoverable dans les églises catholiques.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Calvary (o calvary é palavra latin, ele significa
o skull. A saber Jesus crucified na montanha dos skulls. 
Golgotha na língua aramean significa também o skull.) Os
retratos sobre as estações da cruz são também discoverable em 
igrejas catholic.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Calvary (calvary è parola latina, esso significa
il cranio. Vale a dire Jesus crucified sulla montagna dei 
cranei. Golgotha in lingua aramean significa egualmente il 
cranio.) Le immagini circa le stazioni della traversa sono 
egualmente discoverable in chiese cattoliche.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Calvary (Calvary είναι λατινική λέξη, σημαίνει 
το κρανίο. Δηλαδή ο Ιησούς ήταν στο βουνό των κρανίων. 
Το Golgotha στη γλώσσα Aramean σημαίνει επίσης το 
κρανίο.) Οι εικόνες για τους σταθμούς του σταυρού είναι 
επίσης ανακαλύψιμες στις καθολικές εκκλησίες.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Calvary (el calvary es palabra latina, él 
significa el cráneo. A saber crucificaron a Jesús en la 
montaña de cráneos. Golgotha en lenguaje arameo significa 
también el cráneo.) Los cuadros sobre las estaciones de la 
cruz son también discoverable en iglesias católicas.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Kalvarienberg</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Calvaire</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Calvary</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Calvary</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Calvary</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Calvary</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <educational>
          <learningResourceType>

            <value>image</value>
          </learningResourceType>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <cost>

          </cost>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>

          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="hu">A tartalom kizárólag kizárólag az oktatás illetve tudományos kutatás céljára használható szigorúan non-profit jelleggel.</string>
            <string language="en">The content may be used for the sole purpose of illustration for teaching or scientific research and only for a strictly non-commercial purpose.</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
